questions.question_text:
A company provides a software as a service (SaaS) application. The company has a new customer that is based in a different country. The new customer's data needs to be hosted in that country.

Which AWS service or infrastructure component should the company use to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
C. AWS Regions.

To meet the requirement of hosting data in a specific country, the company should use an AWS region that is located in that country. AWS Regions are geographic locations where AWS provides services. Each region consists of multiple availability zones that are physically separated from each other within a region to provide fault tolerance and scalability. By selecting the appropriate region, the company can ensure that the new customer's data is hosted in the desired country.

Selected Answer: C
The AWS service or infrastructure component that the company can use to meet the requirement of hosting data in a specific country is AWS Regions. Option C is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which AWS service is used to temporarily provide federated security credentials to access AWS resources?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Simple Token Service (AWS STS)

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/welcome.html

"AWS provides AWS Security Token Service (AWS STS) as a web service that enables you to request temporary, limited-privilege credentials for users."

B. AWS Simple Token Service (AWS STS) is used to temporarily provide federated security credentials to access AWS resources. It enables customers to request temporary, limited-privilege credentials for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users or for users that you authenticate (federated users).

Selected Answer: B
The AWS service that is used to temporarily provide federated security credentials to access AWS resources is AWS Simple Token Service (AWS STS). Option B is the correct answer.

AWS STS is a web service that enables you to request temporary, limited-privilege credentials for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users or for users that you authenticate (federated users). It provides a way to grant access to your AWS resources for users who are not defined in your AWS account.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to centralize its operational data. The company also needs to automate tasks across all of its Amazon EC2 instances.

Which AWS service can the company use to meet these requirements?
In which categories does AWS Trusted Advisor provide recommended actions? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B. Cost optimization
D. Service quotas

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

"AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations that help you follow AWS best practices. Trusted Advisor evaluates your account by using checks. These checks identify ways to optimize your AWS infrastructure, improve security and performance, reduce costs, and monitor service quotas."

The correct categories for recommended actions provided by AWS Trusted Advisor are B (Cost optimization) and D (Service quotas). Operating system patches, repetitive tasks, and account activity records are not included as categories in AWS Trusted Advisor.

Selected Answer: BD
The two categories in which AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommended actions are:

B. Cost optimization: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations for optimizing costs by identifying opportunities to reduce waste, improve performance, and increase utilization.

D. Service quotas: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations for managing your AWS service quotas, which limit the amount of resources you can use in a given region.

AWS Trusted Advisor does not provide recommendations for operating system patches, repetitive tasks, or account activity records. It focuses on providing recommendations related to security, fault tolerance, performance, and cost optimization.
